page.title: 09 GOVERNMENT
page.content: The Parish of Beguildy is administered by a three-tier system of government as well as the national government. The Powys County Council, the Radnor District Council and the Beguildy Community Council all levy part of the rates. Powys County Council is responsible for the maintenance of the highways, health, education and the library service. The Radnor District Council looks after council housing, planning and sewage. The Beguildy Community Council makes recommendations and requests to the other two councils. One of the Radnor District Councillors, Councillor W.V.S Corbett, lives in Felindre and represents the parish. Beguildy Community Council consists of eleven members drawn from all parts of the parish.
